page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT IN CROSTON
page.content: More than 50% of workers work outside the village. Some{commute}to cities of Preston and Liverpool (mainly{white {collar workers)}Others work in nearby towns. {Local work}Market Gardening &{Farming are important, also local sawmill, tilers, underwear factory, caravan fittings, textiles and joiners.Recent closures of Brick kiln and Eccleston mill have caused rise in unemployment but is still below national average. Remainder employed in the{retail}and{ {service industries.}There is a relatively high proportion of{self- {employment}including shops, farms, furniture making, building, bakeries, garages, pottery, potato merchants, health club. Schools offer{ancillary {work}particularly to women. Many wives work and most families have at least 2 incomes. Some{seasonal work}on land.
